ygData.subject: Re: Extended Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: Yay Toronto! Nice to meet you.  I hope you had a happy pride! I marched in the parade this year. Starting level 1s can be a lot of fun.  It s pretty easy to
ygData.messageBody:
Yay Toronto! Nice to meet you. I hope you had a happy pride! I marched in the parade this year.

Starting level 1s can be a lot of fun. It's pretty easy to get those first 10 or so levels. There's no feeling like leveling from 1 to 5 in the course of a couple hours. I consider myself someone of a elf supernewbie, since I know I can just throw any 1st level character into the Kelethin newbie zone, and get her up to a full set of patchwork, a decent weapon, and 5th level in a couple hours. Kelethin is just such a dream zone.

If I see a guy out with an "I love EQ" T-shirt at one of the local bars, I'll say hi, maybe it will be you =)

- Christina

---- you wrote:
> From: elviramod@...
>
> Wow...it is so great to see this list really taking off :)
>
> Just a brief intro...I'm a 23 year old gay male also living in Toronto (waves to his neighbour Christina *grin*)
> and am currently enrolled in a Computer Programming degree.
>
> I have been playing EQ quite awhile now, yet usually only get my chars to level 10 or so before trying yet another class!
> (Hence my Supernewbie status *grin*)
> I think this list is a great idea as it is good to know I am not the only non-hetero addicted to this game.
>
> I am planning on starting another level 1...probably on the new server, maybe if anyone is interested they might give me a shout...
> but probably many of you are quite attached to your current personas. *smile*
>
> I am looking forward to seeing many more posts and thanks again Christina for getting the ball rolling!
>
> Todd :)
